agent_utterance: Pause for 60 seconds right now to check your hunger. If you’re genuinely hungry, pick one small, portable option (for example, an apple or a small cup of yogurt) and log it briefly. If you’re not hungry, drink a glass of water, take two slow breaths, and note your fullness. This ultra-simple micro-action fits your plan and helps you stay on track on a hot, busy morning.

agent_utterance: Yes. If you’re out and there’s no snack available, do the 5-4-3-2-1 grounding exercise and log a brief non-food grounding entry in your log (include mood, urge intensity 0–10, duration if you can estimate, and the environmental cue that influenced you most today). If possible, also note that no snack was available and any coping used (water, breath). Consider carrying a small non-food item or pre-packed snack for outings to reduce friction. You’ll reassess after lunch with compassion.
